intro: Astragalus dasyphyllos, commonly known as the thick-leaf milkvetch, is a perennial herb native to the arid and semi-arid regions of western North America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and yellow flowers. The plant has a deep taproot system that allows it to thrive in dry, sandy soils. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed areas, contributing to soil stabilization. Astragalus dasyphyllos is also valued for its ecological role in supporting pollinators and maintaining biodiversity in its native habitat.
